alert.note: Alert for Northwestern San Juan Mountains; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 28 at 6:10PM MST until March 02 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches with 2 to 4 inches below 7000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Northwest San Juan Mountains and Paradox Valley/Lower Dolores River. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, especially in open areas. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Northwestern San Juan Mountains; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River
